videos.title: Compound interest for Kids, Teens, and Beginners #shorts #stockmarketinvesting #financeforkids
videos.description:
When we discovered the 8th wonder of the world which is compound interest, our minds were blown yet disheartened that we had learned so late as adults.

This is what we are working so hard to change!

This is why the EARLIER you start, the BETTER! AND this is why we strongly urge parents/guardians (yes, YOU ) to start your kids early! Can you imagine how their portfolio could look when they turn 18? And don’t let them have enough discipline to hold until 60! 🤑

Your child could possibly reach millionaire status in their 20s & 30s (of course depending on how much is contributed and your investments choices) all because of the seeds that YOU planted today!

And the best part is that you can start with ANY dollar amount!

Investing is for EVERYONE including your kids!

We firmly believe that students should be introduced to personal finance in the home as well as taught in our school systems. 

Whether you are a parent or educator, Kidvestors is the perfect resource  to help you facilitate and start having those conversations right now.

videos.description:
No you don’t have to be rich to invest!

You and your child/tween/teen can invest as little as $10, $20, or $100 to invest your favorite stocks/index funds/ETFs etc.!

And now because of fractional shares, you no longer have to wait to even be able to afford a full share!

Technology has made it so easy now to invest your money right from your phone or laptop without you even thinking about it! You can start right now by just opening an account at any major brokerage! (Just remember, opening the account itself is not investing. Once you deposit money, you must still select and purchase your investments). 

We are exposing our youth to the power of creating wealth by teaching them to how make their money work for them!

videos.title: Why You Shouldn’t Wait for an Income Tax Refund #shorts #taxes #financialliteracyforkids
videos.description:
It’s tax time! So what does that mean? 👇🏾

You might be awaiting your tax refund (or delaying filing because you know you’re going to owe!)

But did you know that an income tax refund is not necessarily the best decision?

Why let the government earn money on YOUR hard earned money and not you?

It’s better to adjust your deductions so you can receive MORE money throughout the year that you can use to save and/or invest (because remember TIME is one of the greatest advantages to reap the benefits of compound interest!)

KidVestors teaches teens to keep this in mind as they prepare to navigate the workforce!

videos.description:

Raising financially smart kids is not just about teaching them how to manage money, but it can also teach them how to develop good habits that can translate into other areas of their life. 

We have a TON of resources that you can use right now to help teach your kids finance AND teach them life principles in the process.

videos.title: Buying The Dip #stocktrading #stocksfortrading #stocksforkids #stocksforbeginners
videos.description:
We’ve touched on bear markets and bull markets, dollar cost averaging and so much more. But have you ever wondered what triggers the rise and fall of stock prices?

Supply and demand is definitely a major factor! When more people want to buy a stock (demand) the price goes up. On the other hand, when more people want to sell , the supply increases causing the price to go down. 

Although this is a very short clip, we break down the stock market even more in a simple way that our #kidvestors (and beginners) can understand!

videos.title: Let’s make it a GOAL for our students to be financially literate! #Olympics #financialliteracy
Are you ready to retire? #retirementplanning #retirement #investing
videos.description:
What can we do to reverse this?👇

“More than half of people approaching retirement age right now, do not have enough money to be retired.”

Policymakers are not going to save us. And while tomorrow isn’t promised to anyone, the beauty about youth is that there is more time on your side compared to adulthood. The earlier you start learning how to manage your money, save, and invest, the bigger the nest egg you have available for you at retirement. 

After you have put away enough for savings (preferably in an HYSA - high hield savings account), we recommend investing in the following order:1) 401K (invest up until the employer match) 
2) Roth or Traditional IRA up unto the annual contribution limit 
3) Health Savings Account 
4 )Brokerage Account (this is another type of invesment account that can be used anytime and before age 59.5)

Our youth don’t have to fall into the “work-retire-repeat” cycle. We can prepare them now! 

You can enroll your kids/teens/students in our financial literacy, investing and entrepreneurship program if you want your students to learn how to break the cycle early! https://www.kidvestors.co/kvapp



#financialliteracy #retirementplanning #retirement #investingforbeginners #investing

Building this mindset starts at home, but it’s even better when schools join the mission too!

videos.title: Mr. Wonderful on Financial Literacy #sharktank #financialliteracy #investingforkids
videos.description:
Do you agree?

While we’re grateful for the progress being made to teach financial literacy in schools, let’s be real—there’s still a LOT missing. Most programs barely scratch the surface, skipping over important stuff like how to invest and grow your wealth or start a business to boost your income.

Here’s the thing: #financialliteracy is a life skill EVERYONE needs, yet it’s often taking a back seat in schools. By 8th grade, most students already have the basics they need for life, but advanced subjects may primarily benefit a smaller percentage of students going into specialized fields. Meanwhile, 100% of people deal with money every single day.

So why isn’t financial literacy treated like the core subject it is? That’s exactly what KidVestors is here to change! We go beyond the basics to set students up for success post graduation through investing, entrepreneurship, and more.

Big thanks to @Mr. Wonderful for shining a light on this issue! Tap the link in our bio and let’s start making this a priority! 

What are your thoughts?

videos.title: Why you shouldn’t want a #taxrefund ! #taxrefunds #financialliteracy
videos.description:
It’s tax time! So what does that mean?🤔👇

You might be awaiting your tax refund (or delaying filing because you know that you’re going to owe! 😬)

But did you know that an income tax refund is not necessarily the best decision?

Why let the government earn money on YOUR hard earned money and not you?🚫

It’s better to adjust your deductions so you can receive MORE money throughout the year that you can use to save and/or invest (because remember TIME is one of the greatest advantages to reap the benefits of compound interest!)

KidVestors teaches teens to keep this in mind as they prepare to navigate the workforce! Https://Www.kidvestors.co

——————————

For more financial education resources for your kids and teen, tap the link in our bio.

videos.title: College ROI Calculator | College Cost Calculator
videos.description:
Know your college ROI in just a few clicks ! Your students can try it out in our app at https://www.kidvestors.co/kvapp#howitworks 

Now, with just a few clicks, our students approaching graduation can explore our growing database of colleges, check out tuition costs over four years, compare those numbers with median salaries for their chosen career field, and see their estimated payback period, all in less than two minutes.
